title: Cause and Effect Vocabulary
goal: Learn words for cause, reason, and effect.

sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

Week 16 review:

bridi negation → ?
opposite (scalar) → ?
I don't go → ?

(Answers: na, to'e, mi na klama)

New Material (5-7 min)

New Vocabulary

Lojban Place Structure English
mukti x1 is a motive for action x2 by x3 motive
rinka x1 (event) causes x2 (event) cause
jalge x1 is a result of x2 result
krinu x1 is a reason for x2 reason

Cause and Effect

ti rinka lo nu mi gleki

This causes me to be happy.

lo nu mi gunka cu rinka lo nu mi tatpi

Working causes me to be tired.

Results

ti jalge lo nu mi gunka

This is a result of me working.

Reasons and Motives

ma mukti lo nu do klama

What is the motive for you going?

ti krinu lo nu mi citka

This is the reason I eat.

Key Point

rinka = physical cause, mukti = motive/purpose, krinu = justification, jalge = result.
sections.title: New Material (5-7 min)

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Cause Sentences

Translate:

  1. This causes me to be happy.
  2. Rain causes me to be wet.
  3. Work causes tiredness.
Answers
  1. ti rinka lo nu mi gleki
  2. lo carvi cu rinka lo nu mi cilmo
  3. lo gunka cu rinka lo nu tatpi

Exercise 2: Result Sentences

Translate:

  1. This is the result.
  2. Happiness is a result of success.
  3. What is the result?
Answers
  1. ti jalge
  2. lo gleki cu jalge lo nu snada
  3. ma jalge

Exercise 3: Motive and Reason

Translate:

  1. What is your motive?
  2. This is the reason.
  3. My motive is happiness.
Answers
  1. ma mukti
  2. ti krinu
  3. lo nu mi gleki cu mukti

items.text: This causes me to be happy.
Rain causes me to be wet.
items.answer: `lo carvi cu rinka lo nu mi cilmo`
`lo gunka cu rinka lo nu tatpi`

items.text: Happiness is a result of success.
items.answer: `lo gleki cu jalge lo nu snada`

sections.content:
Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Say aloud:

  1. "This causes happiness." → ti rinka lo nu gleki
  2. "What is the reason?" → ma krinu
  3. "This is the result." → ti jalge

Summary

You learned four cause/effect words: mukti (motive), rinka (cause), jalge (result), krinu (reason).
